attributes.comment:
My comments are to address the proposed revision to USCIS-2006-0044 which
would result in significantly higher fees for adoptions.

To state the obvious, international adoptions are already an expensive
proposition...and getting more expensive by the day.

The bitter reality is that due to "bureaucratic adjustments" by several key
countries, many of us are now taking longer than 18 months to adopt...meaning
we have to refile and pay you TWICE. Applying some common sense, there is no
way you start from completely from scratch the second time when we refile...so
you double your money for less than double the level of effort.

If you increased your fees by this significant amount, it would be easier to swallow
if you used the extra funds to hire more staff - and give us better, quicker service.
But, we know that can't and won't happen as this move is to help the budget.

If you do enact these fee increases, I have two suggestions (that I honestly feel
are constructive) I'd like to offer:
(1) Increase the expiration from 18 to at least 24 months (or even 30) to help us
avoid paying the even higher fees TWICE (and to help reduce YOUR WORKLOAD).
(2) Reduce the fees for second time filing for the same adoption (since you have a
reduced level of effort associated with the renewal).

thanks for your time,
rob gaulke, USAF
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Robert Gaulke
